text: Charlotte Pence Bond (born Charlotte Rose Pence; June 25, 1993) is an American writer. She is the second child and elder daughter of the 48th Vice President of the United States, Mike Pence, and Second Lady of the United States, Karen Pence. She has written for The DePaulia, Thought Catalog, Glamour and The Isis Magazine. She won a regional Emmy Award in 2014 for a movie she co-wrote and served as an associate producer on. She wrote the children's book Marlon Bundo's A Day in the Life of the Vice President, published in 2018. Pence grew up in Arlington County, Virginia. Pence graduated from DePaul University. She is now attending Harvard Divinity School. She married Henry Bond in December 2019. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1993 births Category:Living people Category:American children's writers Category:American movie producers Category:American novelists Category:American poets Category:American screenwriters Category:DePaul University alumni Category:Emmy Award winners Category:Writers from Virginia
title: Charlotte Pence
